intro: Trianthema diffusum, commonly known as the spreading trianthema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Trianthema diffusum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
